newsitem.title: INDONESIA: No immediate plans to widen Indonesia forex band.
newsitem.headline: No immediate plans to widen Indonesia forex band.

text.p: Indonesian central bank governor Sudradjad Djiwandono said on Tuesday that the bank had no immediate plans to widen the rupiah/dollar band on which it bases its intervention in the foreign exchange market.
Speaking at a seminar during which he was expected to announce a widening of the band, Djiwandono said: "We are doing okay. We will do it when needed."

Rumours in overseas markets on Monday that he would announce a widening of the band during his speech had led to a brief rise in the rupiah against the dollar, but the rate eased after central bank officials said no such plan was in the offing.
On Tuesday, the rupiah was virtually unchanged at 2,345.50/2,346.30 against the dollar at 1020 GMT after a 2,345.25/2,346.00 opening.
The band, which is set by the central bank daily, was fixed at 2,346/2,538 rupiah against the dollar on Tuesday.
Djiwandono also said monetary expansion had so far slowed down in 1996 although some economic overheating was still likely in 1997.
"Monetary expansion has slowed down, but the growth of M2 (money supply) and bank loans are still relatively high and still above forecasts," he said.
